newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia, NATO making progress on agreement - Albright.
newsitem.headline: Russia, NATO making progress on agreement - Albright.

text.p: U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright said on Friday that the United States and Russia had made "very important progress" on an agreement between Moscow and the Western NATO alliance.
But she told a news conference after two days of talks with Russian officials that some very complex questions remained.
"I think that we have made some very important progress on this," she said, asked about a document which would define a new relationship between NATO and Russia in the post Cold War world.
Albright said her discussions with Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov had been "serious and constructive". But she added: "It is clear we have some complex questions to resolve."

Primakov told the news conference that the two sides had agreed that the document to be signed by Russia and NATO must have a "mandatory or binding nature". But Albright did not address this point, and it was unclear if the U.S. had agreed to it.

Russia opposes NATO efforts to invite countries of central and eastern Europe to join NATO. Primakov said Russia was doing everything it could to "minimise the negative consequences" of NATO's expansion plans.
